turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about ETown.
turn.1: How did the group ETown form?
turn.2: A job offer as a luthier (guitar repairman) led him to Colorado in 1975, where he met future bandmates Charles Sawtelle, Pete Wernick and Tim O'Brien.
turn.3: Did they start performing together right away?
turn.4: In 1978 they formed the bluegrass group: Hot Rize.
turn.6: In Hot Rize, Nick played the bass and guitar, provided vocals and acted as the group's M.C.
turn.7: Did they ever receive any awards or recognition?
turn.8: The band released ten albums, toured worldwide and appeared on radio and television programs, including Austin City Limits, The Grand Ole Opry and A Prairie Home Companion.
turn.10: Hot Rize earned both a Grammy nomination and the International Bluegrass Music Association's Entertainer of the Year Award before retiring in the spring of 1990. Nick teamed up with Tim O’Brien and Jerry Douglas to form a new group just after Hot Rize retired.
turn.11: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.12: In 1990, Nick accompanied Sam Bush, John Cowan, and Laurie Lewis on an extensive US State Department tour of Eastern Europe and Turkey.
